sense.name: a small group of professionals working in collaboration
sense.examples: A small cadre of scientists wrote a letter to the president advising him of the dangers of such an epidemic. A cadre of real estate lawyers in town has been pushing the redevelopment proposal.

sense.name: the leadership nucleus of a political party or movement
sense.examples: There is now a major schism within the highest cadre of their political party. The intelligence community is trying to identify the cadres within the larger terrorist network.

sense.name: an individual who is a member of a political nucleus
sense.examples: He was the most powerful cadre in their Maoist movement. The reporter arranged an interview with a revolutionary cadre who had recently been wounded.

sense.name: a framework or context for something
sense.examples: Through this film editing, the actor is found again in a different position in the same cadre. (the same time frame) The effect of a cadre, a tracking or a dissolve can have a completely different subtext in a film than it would have under other technical conditions.
